messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] A Shinsengumi tour from US
messages.msgSnippet: ... Have no fear Ms Phil both Ookura and I will join you in your *Whine*. Yes a week is simply Not Enough Time to go where we d all want to go especially when
messages.messageBody:
spiritus saitou wrote:

>*whine* Accomodations in Tokyo are in... Akasaka! *whine*
>
>(and no, Barb, Mitsu does NOT want any cheese to go with that whine)
>
>
Have no fear Ms Phil both Ookura and I will join you in your *Whine*.
Yes a week is simply Not Enough Time to go where we'd all want to go
especially when you factor in the "just be there and soak up the
atmosphere" aspect.

Barbara Sheridan
http://www.barbarasheridan.net
The Blog-- http://www.livejournal.com/users/b_sheridan/



--

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] A Shinsengumi tour from US
messages.msgSnippet: *whine*  Accomodations in Tokyo are in... Akasaka!  *whine* (and no, Barb, Mitsu does NOT want any cheese to go with that whine) Seven days in Japan seems
messages.messageBody:
*whine* Accomodations in Tokyo are in... Akasaka! *whine*

(and no, Barb, Mitsu does NOT want any cheese to go with that whine)

Seven days in Japan seems so... so pointless, though. It's so *quick*. I'd never be able to sleep! And no Aizu?

phil (who'd actually love to go just for the day to walk around Sagara's home town... not that it looks *anything* like what he'd recognize)

from LA on March 28.

http://www.iace-usa.com/us/special_tours.html

Tama
